snippet: A parliamentary report faulted government-industry collusion in Japan’s nuclear accident.
abstract: Japanese parliamentary inquiry concludes that the nuclear accident at Fukushima was a preventable disaster; report challenges some of the main story lines that the government and the operator of the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant have put forward.

byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A parliamentary report faulted government-industry collusion in Japan’s nuclear accident.

headline.main: Inquiry Declares Fukushima Crisis a Man-Made Disaster
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Concludes That Nuclear Crisis in Japan Was a ‘Man-Made Disaster’
